title: Ticket #550: problem with /etc/security/limits
description: /etc/security/limits only appears to apply to the startd after restart
remarks:
2009-Jul-17 11:20:05 by gthain:
/etc/security/limits.conf is read by certain pam modules. In order to have this apply to condor daemons, we could either pam-enable condor, or run condor under a pam-enabled wrapper. The former is a bit scary, as it requires condor to dynamically link to libpam.so, which isn't available as a .a. So, we've recommended to start condor under su (which is pam-enabled)

e.g.

/bin/su root -c "condor_master"

This was acceptable.
creator: matt
